description.narrative: Améliorer la productivité agro-sylvo-pastorale des écosystèmes des cuvettes dans les départements de Gouré et de Maïné-Soroa
seat of a second-order administrative division

activity-description.narrative: Fixation/réhabilitation des dunes dans les départements de Gouré et Mainé Soroa.

description.narrative: seat of a second-order administrative division

activity-description.narrative: Renforcement des capacités des acteurs et vulgarisation des bonnes pratiques en matière de Gestion durable des terres à Mainé Soroa et Gouré.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: A monitoring system on sand dune and land degradation is established and implemented at national level and harmonized with SIPTerrAfrica at regional level
8 Number of projects and institutions that use the sand dune and land degradation indicators to planmonitor their activities

comment.narrative: No indicators on sand dune and land degradation in place
At least 6 projects andor institutions in the country use the new Centers indicators to planmonitor activities

Target achieved Twenty four 24 Local Natural Resource Management Committees COGERNAT have been established and trained to take over future GDT good practice experiment sites A document of results capitalization on dunes and land degradation monitoring has been developed and made available for programs projects NGOs and other partners Some projects of WFP and FAO are using the sand dune and land degradation indicators to plan their activities
At least 6 projects andor institutions in the country use the new Centers indicators to planmonitor activities

Target achieved Twenty four 24 Local Natural Resource Management Committees COGERNAT have been established and trained to take over future GDT good practice experiment sites A document of results capitalization on dunes and land degradation monitoring has been developed and made available for programs projects NGOs and other partners Some projects of WFP and FAO are using the sand dune and land degradation indicators to plan their activities

description.narrative: 7 Development of a sand dune and land degradation monitoring system national scope and application in Goure and MaineSoroa provinces

comment.narrative: No such monitoring system exists
Sand dune and land degradation monitoring system is established through the new National Ecological Monitoring Centre

Target achieved The CNSEE is managing the Database related to silting monitoring piezometric groundwater monitoring pluviometric situation and herbaceous vegetation monitoring The annual monitoring report is available for each year
Sand dune and land degradation monitoring system is established through the new National Ecological Monitoring Centre

Target achieved The CNSEE is managing the Database related to silting monitoring piezometric groundwater monitoring pluviometric situation and herbaceous vegetation monitoring The annual monitoring report is available for each year

description.narrative: An adaptive and lessonssharing management system in place
10 Publications and IEC materials to disseminate sand land and ecosystem management practices

comment.narrative: Few publications and IEC materials available
MTR and Final Evaluation rate publications and IEC materials produced as SATISFACTORY based on criteria of quantity pedagogic quality and usage level

Pending the TE to inform on target achievement but assumed at a very good stand 150 manuals of good practices on Land management have been produced and disseminated Also the National Forum on fight against desertification held on 19 may 2015 in Niamey has allowed many people to understand sand land and ecosystem management practices
MTR and Final Evaluation rate publications and IEC materials produced as SATISFACTORY based on criteria of quantity pedagogic quality and usage level

Pending the TE to inform on target achievement but assumed at a very good stand 150 manuals of good practices on Land management have been produced and disseminated Also the National Forum on fight against desertification held on 19 may 2015 in Niamey has allowed many people to understand sand land and ecosystem management practices

description.narrative: 9 Number of nonproject stakeholders that visit project sites and activities for learningreplicating

comment.narrative: The Goure and MaineSoroa provinces receive no much visits in relation to best practices or SLM innovations
At least 8 nonproject stakeholders from other departments or abroad visit project sites to learn from projects best practices and innovations
The target is already surpassed since last reporting period
At least 8 nonproject stakeholders from other departments or abroad visit project sites to learn from projects best practices and innovations
The target is already surpassed since last reporting period

description.narrative: Sustainable dune land and ecosystem management activities are implemented at the grassroots level covering approx 7510 ha of land
3 Multiannual operation plan for the protection of 35 strategic oasis microbasins

comment.narrative: No operational plan available meanwhile 580 and 287 villages are subjected to sand invasion in MaineSoroa and Goure respectively
Operational plan for the protection of 35 strategic microbasins is elaborated and validated during 1st year and is implemented from 2nd year

Target closely achieved at 80 which is already considered a reasonable achievement During the reporting period PLECO project did not work with local action plans for the management of dunes The project worked directly with the beneficiaries of the 60 pilot sites of land management by consolidating the efforts made previous years
Operational plan for the protection of 35 strategic microbasins is elaborated and validated during 1st year and is implemented from 2nd year

Target closely achieved at 80 which is already considered a reasonable achievement During the reporting period PLECO project did not work with local action plans for the management of dunes The project worked directly with the beneficiaries of the 60 pilot sites of land management by consolidating the efforts made previous years

description.narrative: 4 Number of experimentation sites for best NRM practices in agropastoral systems installed

comment.narrative: Poor knowledge on best NRM practices in agropastoral systems
90 sites of pilot experimentation and demonstration of agricultural and pastoral good practices are installed with full population engagement

Target partially achieved at 63 Though a target of 90 sites was not achieved but 57 is considered a reasonable achievement under the circumstances Only 60 demonstration sites of techniques for mechanical and biological fixation of dunes were operational during the reporting period 30 demonstration sites of assisted natural regeneration technique However this is still considered a major achievement The target level was perhaps too ambitious
90 sites of pilot experimentation and demonstration of agricultural and pastoral good practices are installed with full population engagement

Target partially achieved at 63 Though a target of 90 sites was not achieved but 57 is considered a reasonable achievement under the circumstances Only 60 demonstration sites of techniques for mechanical and biological fixation of dunes were operational during the reporting period 30 demonstration sites of assisted natural regeneration technique However this is still considered a major achievement The target level was perhaps too ambitious

description.narrative: Technical and managerial capacity of local stakeholders on dune land and ecosystem management is strengthened in the 35 priority microbasins
6 Number of COFOs land tenure committees that improve dissemination of SLM practices and conflict resolution efforts

comment.narrative: COFOs show very weak capacities and poor functioning
At least half of the COFOs in the Goure and MaineSoroa provinces improve their functioning thanks to the project

Target assumed achieved or on the way to being achieved but generally not measurable refer to 2013 reporting The number of the COFOs established in the Goure and MaineSoroa provinces did not change 13 strategic sites have been supported by local land commissions
At least half of the COFOs in the Goure and MaineSoroa provinces improve their functioning thanks to the project

Target assumed achieved or on the way to being achieved but generally not measurable refer to 2013 reporting The number of the COFOs established in the Goure and MaineSoroa provinces did not change 13 strategic sites have been supported by local land commissions

description.narrative: 5 of the population that acquire practical knowledge on sand land and ecosystem management in the priority 35 microbasins

comment.narrative: Poor awareness and training opportunities on SLMrelated knowledge and practices and high levels of illiteracy

Target achieved in previous reporting periods and now consolidated We highlight that 150 manuals of good practice on SLM were broadcast and 847 rural households have been trained and supervised in mechanical and biological fixation of dunes 18600 people sensitized on sand land and ecosystem management

description.narrative: To protect the integrity of and to improve the agrosylvopastoral productivity of the microbasin ecosystems in Goure and MaineSoroa provinces
1a

comment.narrative: 0ha at project start
PLECO 4410 ha

Target achieved during the reporting period
4480 ha of dune stabilized by PLECO project supported by GEF
PLECO 4410 ha

Target achieved during the reporting period
4480 ha of dune stabilized by PLECO project supported by GEF

description.narrative:
1 Extension under dune protection and SLM practices
Note the latter part of indicator 1 is better captured under indicator 2

comment.narrative: 305000 ha under risk of sand invasion in Goure and MaineSoroa provinces There is a serious sand invasion problem exacerbated by non sustainable land and natural resource management practices this problem is confirmed in development district plans

7510 ha protected in the microbasins and on sylvopastoral spaces as follows
Breakdown below and includes both PLECO and partner financed interventions

Targets have been achieved in 2011 and have now been taken to another level 13010 ha of dune stabilized the risk of sand invasion in Goure and MaineSoroa provinces is considerably reduced During the reporting period GEF and UNDP contributed directly to stabilize 360 ha of dune And the Government of Niger contributed to stabilize 265 ha of dune

7510 ha protected in the microbasins and on sylvopastoral spaces as follows
Breakdown below and includes both PLECO and partner financed interventions

Targets have been achieved in 2011 and have now been taken to another level 13010 ha of dune stabilized the risk of sand invasion in Goure and MaineSoroa provinces is considerably reduced During the reporting period GEF and UNDP contributed directly to stabilize 360 ha of dune And the Government of Niger contributed to stabilize 265 ha of dune

description.narrative: 2b Bean productivity in Goure

comment.narrative: Goure 109 kgha
increase the productivity up to 20 from the base line

Target achieved and slightly surpassed Goure 130 kgha Bean productivity increased because the level of fertilization has improved and also the phenomenon of water and wind erosion has been significantly reduced due to the application of assisted natural regeneration technique
increase the productivity up to 20 from the base line

Target achieved and slightly surpassed Goure 130 kgha Bean productivity increased because the level of fertilization has improved and also the phenomenon of water and wind erosion has been significantly reduced due to the application of assisted natural regeneration technique

description.narrative: 2a Millet productivity in Goure

comment.narrative: Goure 261 kg ha
Productivity of agropastoral areas increases by at least 20 by the end of the project
Target surpassed since 2014 Goure 530 kgha This result is due to the PLECO project effort and also to the contribution of others partners like FAO which provided improved seeds of millet
Productivity of agropastoral areas increases by at least 20 by the end of the project
Target surpassed since 2014 Goure 530 kgha This result is due to the PLECO project effort and also to the contribution of others partners like FAO which provided improved seeds of millet

description.narrative: 2a Millet productivity in Maine

comment.narrative: Maine 410 kgha
increase the productivity up to 20 from the base line

Target achieved but with a drop since last year which is considered normal given expected variability in agricultural productivity from year to year for reasons that are external to the project Maine 650 kgha The improvement trends are though a result from the PLECO projects effort and also to the contribution of others partners like FAO which disseminated improved seeds of millet Comparatively to last year the productivity has decreased but from all accounts this is due to a less than good the rain season Such variations are expected What matters is the long term trend and average We have little data to compare but note a general increase that can be attributed to the project
increase the productivity up to 20 from the base line

Target achieved but with a drop since last year which is considered normal given expected variability in agricultural productivity from year to year for reasons that are external to the project Maine 650 kgha The improvement trends are though a result from the PLECO projects effort and also to the contribution of others partners like FAO which disseminated improved seeds of millet Comparatively to last year the productivity has decreased but from all accounts this is due to a less than good the rain season Such variations are expected What matters is the long term trend and average We have little data to compare but note a general increase that can be attributed to the project

increase the productivity up to 20 from the base line

description.narrative: 2 Improvement of agropastoral productivity in the 35 priority microbasins and 5 sylvopastoral spaces that receive project support

comment.narrative: See breakdown below
Productivity of agropastoral areas increases by at least 20 by the end of the project

Target achieved and surpassed Productivity of agropastoral areas increases by at least 40 The increasing of productivity is due to the fact that PLECO Project has built capacities of beneficiaries by the technic of RNA Assisted Natural Generation of some plants species on agropastoral areas
Productivity of agropastoral areas increases by at least 20 by the end of the project

Target achieved and surpassed Productivity of agropastoral areas increases by at least 40 The increasing of productivity is due to the fact that PLECO Project has built capacities of beneficiaries by the technic of RNA Assisted Natural Generation of some plants species on agropastoral areas

description.narrative: 2b Bean productivity

comment.narrative: See breakdown below
Productivity of agropastoral areas increases by at least 20 by the end of the project

Target achieved and slightly surpassed Productivity of agropastoral areas increases by at least 15 due to the fact that farmers are trained in assisting the natural regeneration in 30 pilot sites The practice of assisted natural regeneration is still one of the best practices that allow to improve the level of soils fertilization on project sites
Productivity of agropastoral areas increases by at least 20 by the end of the project

Target achieved and slightly surpassed Productivity of agropastoral areas increases by at least 15 due to the fact that farmers are trained in assisting the natural regeneration in 30 pilot sites The practice of assisted natural regeneration is still one of the best practices that allow to improve the level of soils fertilization on project sites
